sense.name: moving, delivering, etc
sense.commentary: The act of moving, carrying, delivering, or working with something, either manually or mechanically. Does not require or imply actually touching something with your hands.
sense.examples: My printer cost $80, plus $12.99 for shipping and handling. The package broke due to rough handling. I've been working in the handling division of John's warehouse.

sense.name: touching with hands
sense.commentary: HANDLING[+event] The act of touching something with the hands, or manipulating something skillfully with hands.
sense.examples: John's inappropriate handling of Mary got him slapped with a sexual harrassment suit. The Globetrotters have always demonstrated excellent ball-handling skills. Too much direct handling will ruin a photograph.

sense.name: abstract management
sense.commentary: HANDLING[+event] The management of someone or something. How people deal with a situation. No actual touching is involved.
sense.examples: John's delicate handling of the Smithers account got him a promotion to management. One can judge the development of a civilization by the handling of its prisoners. The handling of the whole economy was too big a task for the Soviet government.
